message.content: It's difficult to make a generalized statement about which political group is "less bad" as each has its own set of values and policies that can be considered good or bad depending on the individual's perspective. However, it's important to note that all three groups have their own flaws and strengths. It's up to the person to evaluate and choose the one they align with based on their beliefs and principles. Some people may find certain aspects of each group more appealing than others. Comparing them in a general sense is subjective, as it depends on personal values and priorities.
